policies.title: AB 2885 - AI Literacy Act
policies.description: Requires the California Department of Education to develop a model AI literacy curriculum for K-12 schools.
policies.summary_text: Directs CDE to develop model AI literacy guidelines and resources for incorporation into math, science, and computer science curriculum frameworks. Requires consideration of AI ethics, bias, and societal impact.

policies.title: Executive Order N-12-23 on AI
policies.description: Governor Newsom's executive order establishing California's approach to AI, including education provisions.
policies.summary_text: Directs state agencies to study AI risks and benefits. Includes provisions for workforce development and education system preparedness for AI integration.

policies.title: HB 2985 - AI in Education Study
policies.description: Directs the Oregon Department of Education to study the use of AI in schools and report findings.
policies.summary_text: Requires ODE to convene a work group to study AI use in education, examine impacts on students and teachers, and deliver recommendations to the legislature.

policies.title: HB 2094 - AI Literacy Education
policies.description: Requires AI literacy concepts to be integrated into Virginia's computer science standards of learning.
policies.summary_text: Mandates the Board of Education to incorporate AI literacy into computer science standards, including understanding AI capabilities, limitations, ethical considerations, and societal impact.

policies.title: SB 5693 - AI Task Force
policies.description: Establishes a task force on AI in Washington state government, including education applications.
policies.summary_text: Creates an AI task force to examine AI use across state agencies including education. Requires recommendations on responsible AI adoption, workforce impacts, and student data protection.

policies.title: SB 812 - AI in Education Task Force
policies.description: Creates a legislative study commission on AI use in public schools.
policies.summary_text: Establishes the Joint Legislative Study Commission on AI in Public Schools to study current and potential use of AI, examine impacts on teaching and learning, and recommend legislation.

policies.title: PA 24-151 - AI in Education Working Group
policies.description: Establishes a working group to study and make recommendations regarding AI in education.
policies.summary_text: Creates an AI in Education Working Group under the State Department of Education to study AI impacts on K-12 education and develop recommendations for responsible AI integration.

policies.title: A8195 - AI in Education Study Bill
policies.description: Directs the commissioner of education to study AI use in schools.
policies.summary_text: Directs the commissioner of education to conduct a study on the use of AI in elementary and secondary education, examining both opportunities and risks.

policies.title: HB 3261 - AI Advisory Council
policies.description: Creates a state AI advisory council with education sector representation.
policies.summary_text: Establishes the AI Advisory Council to study and monitor AI systems used by state agencies. Includes education representatives and examines AI impacts on the education workforce.

policies.title: HB 3563 - AI Video Content in Schools
policies.description: Addresses AI-generated video content in educational settings.
policies.summary_text: Requires school districts to adopt policies regarding AI-generated video and image content, including deepfakes, in the school environment.

policies.title: HB 24-1468 - AI Transparency in Education
policies.description: Requires transparency when AI systems are used in educational decisions.
policies.summary_text: Requires educational institutions to disclose when AI systems are used in consequential decisions affecting students. Establishes transparency and notification requirements.

policies.title: AI Literacy Act of 2024
policies.description: Federal bill to promote AI literacy in K-12 education nationwide.
policies.summary_text: Establishes a grant program through the Department of Education to support AI literacy education in K-12 schools. Funds curriculum development, teacher training, and research.

policies.title: AI in Education Act of 2023
policies.description: Federal bill to study AI impacts on education and create recommendations.
policies.summary_text: Directs the Department of Education to conduct a comprehensive study on AI in education, develop recommendations for responsible AI use, and create resources for educators.

policies.title: CREATE AI Act of 2023
policies.description: Federal bill to establish AI education and workforce development programs.
policies.summary_text: Creates competitive grant programs for AI education, including K-12 AI literacy, teacher training, and higher education AI programs. Focuses on equitable access.

policies.title: Executive Order 14110 on Safe AI
policies.description: President Biden's executive order on AI safety, including education provisions.
policies.summary_text: Comprehensive executive order on AI safety and security. Includes directives for the Department of Education to develop resources for AI-enabled education, create guidelines for AI use in schools, and address equity concerns.

policies.title: A4319 - AI in Education Act
policies.description: Establishes requirements for AI use in New Jersey public schools.
policies.summary_text: Requires the Department of Education to develop guidelines for AI use in public schools, including teacher training requirements and student data protection standards.

policies.title: AI Literacy Pilot Program
policies.description: Massachusetts Department of Education AI literacy pilot in select school districts.
policies.summary_text: DESE launched a pilot program in partnership with select districts to develop and test AI literacy curriculum frameworks for grades 6-12.

policies.title: SR 321 - AI in Education Study Committee
policies.description: Creates a Senate study committee on AI in education.
policies.summary_text: Establishes a Senate study committee to examine the use of AI in Georgia's education system, focusing on opportunities, risks, and needed policy frameworks.

policies.title: SB 1227 - AI Education Standards
policies.description: Requires Pennsylvania to develop AI education standards for K-12.
policies.summary_text: Directs the Department of Education to develop and implement AI education standards for K-12 schools, including AI literacy, computational thinking, and ethical AI use.

policies.title: AI Guidance for Schools
policies.description: Wisconsin DPI guidance document on AI use in K-12 schools.
policies.summary_text: Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction published comprehensive guidance for schools on responsible AI use, covering academic integrity, teacher tools, and student data privacy.

policies.title: AI in Education Guidance Framework
policies.description: Ohio Department of Education AI guidance for districts and schools.
policies.summary_text: Ohio's Department of Education and Workforce released a framework providing guidance to districts on integrating AI tools, addressing academic integrity, and protecting student data.

policies.title: HB 513 - AI Learning Amendments
policies.description: Requires AI literacy instruction in Utah schools.
policies.summary_text: Amends education code to include AI literacy as part of the digital literacy standards for K-12 students. Requires integration into existing technology and computer science courses.

policies.title: HB 1591 - AI Task Force
policies.description: Creates an AI task force with education sector focus in Indiana.
policies.summary_text: Establishes an AI task force to study the impact of AI across Indiana, with specific attention to education, workforce development, and state agency use of AI tools.

policies.title: HF 3775 - AI Literacy in Schools
policies.description: Establishes AI literacy requirements in Minnesota's academic standards.
policies.summary_text: Requires the commissioner of education to incorporate AI literacy into Minnesota's academic standards, including understanding AI systems, ethical implications, and practical applications.

policies.title: CS/HB 1361 - Computer Science and AI Education
policies.description: Expands computer science education to include AI concepts.
policies.summary_text: Amends Florida education statutes to include artificial intelligence within computer science education standards. Requires AI concepts to be taught as part of the K-12 computer science curriculum.
